plugins.name: Hero Patterns for Figma
plugins.description:
Hire me as your Figma plugin developer. Reach out at tekeste@spelll.design.


This plugin brings the amazing collection of patterns called Hero patterns by Steve Schoger. They are a collection of repeatable SVG background patterns for you to use on your web or mobile projects.


All you have to do is select a layer and customize the color of the patterns using the handy color picker and click on your favorite pattern and it will get applied as a fill for that layer.

You can mix and match the patterns and stack them up by clicking again and again, this will place each new pattern on top of the other.


— Other plugins by @tkmadeit


https://www.figma.com/c/plugin/754026612866636376/SPELLL---Spell-Checking-for-Figma


https://www.figma.com/c/plugin/739503328703046360/Humaaans-for-Figma

plugins.name: AutoHTML | Components to Code
plugins.description:
New: Angular!


Export React, Vue, Svelte, Angular or HTML with Tailwind or CSS Styling.


Works in Dev Mode & Design Mode. No registration required - simply run the plugin and select a frame!

Check out the Demo File.


Have any questions?

Join Slack for support, questions or feedback.


Report Issues and Bugs here.


Tipps:

  1. Use Auto layout and constraints.
  2. Color styles, text styles, and effect styles will be transferred as CSS variables or Tailwind config.
  3. The CSS classes are named after the layers in Figma.
  4. To maximize the plugin's potential, avoid using groups and keep the layers as simple as possible.


Advanced Tipps for React/Vue/Svelte/Angular:

  1. Boolean, text and instance swap component properties will be exported if you select a component.
  2. Enable the "Nested Components" option in the settings to create components from all instances within your current selection.
  3. Variants can be exported as well.
  4. Receive a Zip folder containing all component files and a package.json.
  5. Install the dependencies (Node.js required) using npm i and start coding.


Please note: The generated code is not production-ready but serves as a starting point for developers.
plugins.tagline: React, Vue, Svelte, Angular, Tailwind, HTML & CSS Converter

plugins.name: Calendar Generator
plugins.description:
Creates a calendar grid of 12/24/36 months (with week numbering) depending on the selected years.


• Components: It is enough to customize the appearance of an instance of one monthly block, after which it can be replaced with another. The formatting will remain (adjust the view before deleting elements). Text: text only, no components.

• Language: Select a language.

• View: vertical or horizontal arrangement of elements in the block.

• First day of the week: Monday or Sunday.

• Week Number: Select the week numbering.


Example of working with a plugin: https://youtu.be/RUobJQn89wM

plugins.name: Wave & Сurve
plugins.description:
With «Wave & Curve» you can easily create a variety of waves and interesting patterns!

Four modes are supported*: 
- with two control points (cubic curve); 
- with one control point (quadratic curve).
- Arc curve.
- Square curve.

You can choose the direction of the waves : Top and Bottom, Top, Bottom.

Locks near the parameters (appear on hover) allow you to lock them for the Random.

* This only matters at the time of generation, Figma converts all curves to cubic.

plugins.name: Google Maps - Map Maker (free)
plugins.description:
Add a Google Map (with 20 styles) to your Figma Documents!


Map Maker is a free tool for Figma to help you add a Google Map to any of your pages. Just search for the part of the world, choose a style (over 20 to choose from), and whether you want it to be road map, satellite view etc. Here are more details:


👋🏻 First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All themes and settings are available at no charge


🔎 Search for the exact location:

  1. Easy search: just enter the name of the city or region
  2. The search works as it does on Google Maps: you can search for cities, countries, towns, villages, monuments, regions, businesses or addresses


🎨 Choose a theme:

  1. There are 20 themes available to style your map the way you want
  2. This includes the default style for Google Maps


🚗 Choose the map type:

  1. You can choose from four (4) map types: road map, satellite, terrain and hybrid
  2. Each map type works with the themes (although you won't always see the difference with Satellite mode)


📸 Choose hi-fidelity maps:

  1. Choose the "Detailed View" option to have higher-quality maps, with more detail on them (e.g. road names, street names, etc)


🤔 More:

  1. You will always see a preview of what your map will look like before you insert it
  2. You can use your mouse to drag the map around
  3. The search has autocomplete to help you find the right spot
  4. This plugin will remember what you last searched for and your settings so that each time you open it up, you'll be right where you left off


🔗 References:

  1. Some of themes and styles come from the open source project Snazzy Maps: https://snazzymaps.com/


🛟 Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is


🎉🎉🎉
plugins.tagline: Add a Google Map to your pages in 2 easy clicks :)

plugins.name: Vector to 3D
plugins.description:
Vector to 3D brings 3D design into your Figma workflow seamlessly.


It convert your 2D text and vector layers into 3D models with just one click! With the built-in powerful ray tracing renderer. You can create nice 3D icons, banners, mockups, or any other 3D-style images without being a 3D specialist.


Supports:

  1. Mail: shenyi.914@gmail.com
  2. Twitter: https://twitter.com/pissang1


Examples:

  1. Vector to 3D Showcase by Coy-huase
  2. iPhone 15 Pro mockup created by the Vector to 3D plugin


Unofficial Tutorials:

  1. Master 3d Modeling In Figma In Just 10 Minutes
  2. Use Figma to create 3D flower icon in 5 mins
  3. Vector to 3D Tutorial: Build a 3D laptop in Figma


Features:

  1. Convert any kind of vector nodes and text nodes into 3D models with just one click.
  2. Renders to a state-of-the-art image with GPU accelerated ray tracing
  3. Intuitive lighting system
  4. Plastic, glass, metal, emissive, iridescence materials.
  5. Boolean operations and SDF based blending for creating complex 3D objects.
  6. Turntable animation animation sequence rendering. [pro]
  7. Save projects to layers and share to others. [pro]
  8. Export the model to GLB 3D model format. [pro]
  9. Download or insert into figma with high resolution PNG with transparent background. [pro]



PRO License:

To use the PRO features, you need to obtain a license from Gumroad
plugins.tagline: Brings 3D design into your Figma workflow seamlessly.

plugins.name: UX Pilot: AI UI Generator & AI Wireframe Generator
plugins.description:
The most powerful AI UI Generator & Wireframer plugin on Figma.


Guide: Import Generated Designs into Figma

GUIDE (UI Design with AI)

Web App: AI UI Generator


From planning to execution, UX Pilot streamlines the entire UX design process. Just look at what it does:


Create stunning UI designs

Generate pixel perfect UI screens for web and mobile apps and marketing landing pages in a few seconds.


Generate powerful wireframes with AI

Explore concepts and brainstorm ideas with a few seconds, all with the power of AI.


Generate diagrams, flowcharts, sitemaps and information architecture

Describe your use case and product and generate detailed diagrams in FigJam. With color coded levels for better readability.


Review your Designs with AI

Select a frame, click review and receive instant feedback about your design


6 AI Tools for UX to save you hours:

  1. Summarize
  2. Elaborate
  3. Cluster
  4. Apply UX Laws
  5. Use "How Might We"
  6. Custom GPT Prompt


Generate new UX workshops:

Use our AI model to generate new custom UX workshops and frameworks tailored to your use case.


Access 26 templates: We’re offering a huge library of workshop templates. The crazy part? We’ve used them all internally and perfected the formats and instructions over the years.


Get stakeholder buy-in:

Sometimes, stakeholders make it very hard to do UX. They simply won’t cooperate. You can change that. Our e-mail templates help communicate exactly why you need everyone’s input.


Become better at UX:

While working on the tool, we’ve accumulated more than 120 different tips and best practices. These are distributed among template, stakeholder instructions and workshop overviews.


How to Use:

  1. Install the plugin.
  2. Browse through our workshop library or generate your own.
  3. Use available AI tools for enhanced data processing during or post-workshop.

plugins.name: Palette
plugins.description:
Palette is being retired, try Colormate instead! :)


Colormate: https://www.figma.com/community/plugin/1342570927018071414/colormate


-------


Palette helps you create the perfect color palette through machine learning from Colormind.


Usage


When you open Palette it will detect which shapes you have selected and use their fill colors (up to 5) or an image fill to seed your new color palette.


Color palettes are generated automatically using machine intelligence. You can click on colors to lock them in as you generate new colors and drag colors to reorder. The order of colors in your palette can have a major impact on how the service decides to fill in the blanks. So, please remember to experiment with the order of your colors.


Though the "Normal" color model is selected for you, you can try other models provided by Colormind. The "Normal" and "UI" models are always available but the rest of the list changes daily.


Once you stumble upon a color palette you are excited about, just click the checkmark and Palette will throw shapes filled with your new colors down on the page.

plugins.name: Blend
plugins.description:
Blend plugin allows you to copy any object along the path.


How it works

  1. Select an object you want to clone, then select the path and the Blend Group will be created (it's a regular group but it stores useful data about the blend so it's not recommended to ungroup it).
  2. Change the number of copies or the distance that you want to keep between them to make the composition fit your needs.
  3. While the plugin is open you can also edit the blend path and you will see changes in real time.


★ Check out the design & development process of this plugin on Behance: https://www.behance.net/gallery/83421531/Blend-Plugin-for-Figma-Creation-Process


Features

  • You can click on layers to select them, they will also reflect which layer is currently selected on the canvas.
  • Replace blend path or object by clicking the pencil icon near them and selecting the object you want to change it to.
  • Click the Remove Blend button to quickly remove all copies and keep your original object and path.


Tips

  • Use an instance of a component as the main object to be able to easily change its properties.
  • Select an object and a path when opening the plugin and it may be able to automatically detect them and create the Blend Group.
  • Select an existing blend group when opening the plugin to edit it instead of creating a new one.


Known issues

  • If you edited the node you are copying, change the number of steps to update the copies.
  • If you use Cmd + Z it may break the blend and you will have to manually remove copies, reselect the missing object or restart the plugin.
  • You cannot use anything other than a simple vector object as a path. If you want to use a shape like an ellipse, flatten it first (Right-click -> Flatten).

plugins.name: oblique
plugins.description:
create oblique projections of any shape. useful for creating shadows, 3d depth, visual perspective, and more!


oblique calculates tangent points itself, ensuring correct projections from any possible input shape.


this plugin was inspired by the Adobe Illustrator plugin opo by 63mutants.


also check out Roto, a similar figma plugin having a couple key differences. oblique calculates faces itself instead of relying on a 3d engine, making it faster and produce less complex results, at the cost of some features such as perspective and lighting options.

plugins.name: Web to Figma - Convert any website or HTML code to design
plugins.description:
Web to Figma converts any website or HTML code to fully editable Figma designs.


Web to Figma is your go-to plugin to convert, collect and save, website design inspirations into Figma as fully editable components.


How it works


Web to Figma lets you import full website or HTML code into an editable Figma file using the plugin, or import specific components from a website, using our Chrome Extension.


Import webpages using the plugin:


1. Install the plugin

2. From within any file, run the plugin by going to Plugins menu and selecting Web to Figma

3. In the Import tab of the plugin, enter the URL of the webpage that you want to import.

4. Choose the relevant settings

5. Click on Import


Import components or websites using the Chrome Extension:


1. Install the Web to Figma Chrome Extension from Chrome Web Store

2. Go to any website in your Chrome Browser

3. Invoke the extension, and then choose if you want to capture the entire page design or a single component

4. Once the extension captures the page, save the page/component to a Collection

5. Go to Figma and run the plugin

6. Go to the Collections tab of the plugin

7. Find your latest capture and click on Add to Figma


Benefits


1. Create a library of website design inspirations using collections

2. Create a mood-board

3. Collaborate with developers by importing their HTML code implementation and comparing against the reference design

4. Learn how some of the more complex websites have been structured

5. Quickly explore various design patterns when solving a new task


Web to Figma Pro Feature Benefits:


The PRO plan caters to designers leveraging the plugin extensively, aiming to enhance and accelerate their design workflow.


Upgrade to Web to Figma PRO to enjoy limitless website or HTML imports, advanced functionalities, and be among the first to access our latest features to level up your design game.


Features include:


  1. Unlimited exports
  2. Unlimited collections
  3. Icon imports
  4. Style imports
  5. Custom viewport sizing
  6. Priority support
  7. Early access to upcoming features


Support:


💬 Having issues? Talk to us on Discord

plugins.name: Tablefy
plugins.description:
Export your frames and instances to tabular data (.csv).


Let's say you manage some tasks on your Figma files and want to export a .csv to filter by status, send it to someone or upload to Google Sheets. Tablefy will help you do just that.


How to use it

Tablefy relies on your layers naming to recognize how to transform your frames / instances to tabular data.


As an example, you could create a list of instances with the following layer structure and names:


👉 Instance named "Item"

Group named "Column"

  • Text Layer named "Header" filled with text "Name"
  • Text Layer named "Value" filled with text "Task 1"

Group named "Column"

  • Text Layer named "Header" filled with text "Status"
  • Text Layer named "Value" filled with text "To do"


So, you could open the plugin and set the values:

  • Row identifier: "Item"
  • Column Identifier: "Column"
  • Value text layer: "Value"
  • Header text layer: "Header"


When you hit Tablefy button, it will generate a .csv with two columns (Name, Status) and as many rows as the frames or instances you selected.


You can add as many columns as you want! If your frame just have one useful column, you can ignore "Column Identifier" and keep it empty.


It's recommended that you always use instances, since they guarantee each selected frame has always the same layers.


Custom columns:

You can add custom dynamic columns. Let's say you want to export an url to your frame listed as a row in the csv. You could add a custom column and set its value to "${url}". You can use node parameters as well, like ${node-id}, ${node-name}, ${node-x}.

Available variables:

  • ${url} - creates an url to the frame
  • ${index} - adds a counter relative to the frame list position
  • ${node-prop} - retrieve properties from the figma node object, like "node-id", "node-name", "node-x"
  • ${predict:"frameName", category: "frameTextLayer"}
  • ${layerName} - fetch a layer inside that row with this name and get its text contents


Predict columns with Machine Learning

Use the "predict" variable in a dynamic column to apply a classification automatically using the KNN (K-Nearest Neighbours) algorithm. It finds the nearest frame to the row node and sets a value from a layer of that closer framer.


This can be really useful if your spacial organization has some meaning that you want to export to the rows. If you have a canvas with titled areas, you could export with your rows which title frame was closer to it.


An example:

If you set a custom column value field like: ${predict:"frameName", category: "frameTextLayer"}

For each node (row) we will look at all the frames named "frameName", find which one is closer to the node and apply to this column that frame's "frameTextLayer" content.

plugins.description:
Convert Figma designs to editable powerpoint presentations using Deck. 


Deck is a free powerpoint converter using which you can convert your beautiful designs into an editable presentations. Deck supports text & basic shapes. All non supported type layers are converted as an image.


Note

The file conversion all happens within Figma. No files/configuration is send or received from the server.


Privacy

We send specific data to the server such as country/region, slide count, error logs to monitor and maintain plugin support.


Links

Feedback -> https://feedback.deck.is/

Documentation -> https://docs.deck.is/getting-started/figma

plugins.name: BlendingMe
plugins.description:
How to use https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WcnCOTWjq-0


BlendingMe is the optimal method for blending two lines, ellipses, or rectangles. It is incredibly user-friendly: simply select the two objects you wish to blend, determine the number of blending steps, and click Create.


Moreover, you can adjust the blending path, color, stroke weight, and opacity in REALTIME while the plugin is in operation. Once you are content with the outcome, you can close the plugin.

Here are the properties that you can modify in real-time while the plugin is working:

  • Paths of lines
  • Change solid stroke color
  • Change solid fill color
  • Increase or decrease stroke weight
  • Adjust opacity
  • Rotate elements
  • Move elements to a different position
  • Increase or decrease border radius corner
  • Resize elements
  • Add layer blur 🔥


BlendingMe is scheduled for an upcoming update that will include even more features to enhance its functionality. 😊

See more information on blendingme.com
plugins.tagline: BlendingMe is a user-friendly plugin that allows you to blend two paths, lines, ellipses, rectangles

plugins.name: Redlines
plugins.description:
As designers, when preparing our work for developer hand-off, there comes a time where we need to annotate our designs with detailed measurements, specs, and intricate redlines—we all know how time-consuming this process can be.

Alas! There is light at the end of the tunnel. 🙌

Figma Redlines is the perfect toolkit for any designer looking to save time when preparing designs for developer hand-off. 

This plugin gives you the ability to create and generate redlines from a selection of objects with ease, while also enabling full control over the style and display of each redline element.

Main Features
- Quickly measure and plot dimensions of any selected object
- A varied selection of outlines and line styles
- Full control over the color, spacing, and font size of each redline element
- Ability to add units to each redline element—PX, %, DP, etc.
- Automatic grouping of redline elements—to help keep things tidy and easy to manage!

To use;
1. Select a layer (or multiple)
2. Customize the redline settings (if you want to)
3. Choose a redline option to plot
4. 🕺

If you have any ideas for features or perhaps ways to improve the plugin,  feel free to reach out—I would love to hear from you!

Oh, and if you've enjoyed the plugin and are feeling generous, you can always... https://www.buymeacoffee.com/4pIjUVg

Enjoy!

plugins.name: Able – Friction free accessibility
plugins.description:
Able makes accessibility easy, while looking and feeling like Figma! 
Add color contrast and color blindness to your workflow with as little effort as possible. Open Able and we will automatically compare the contrast between two layers you select. This way, you can keep Able open, and casually select layers to compare without re-running or updating the plugin!

🤔 Want to know more? We were recently featured in this brilliant article by Thomas Lowry. Check it out: https://www.figma.com/blog/design-for-everyone-with-these-accessibility-focused-plugins/

👋 You can also simulate different types of color blindness on your selected layers in the preview! 

👋 Copy the contrast ratio and scores and paste them into your color style descriptions as documentation!

Made by
Petter Iversen & Sondre Kvam

plugins.name: Downsize
plugins.description:
Compress and resize images without leaving Figma or FigJam!

Downsize is perfect if you want your files to load faster and use less memory.


How to use it

  1. Select anything on the canvas or keep selection empty — Downsize will find all images within a selection or on a page
  2. Add settings to compress and/or resize images — mix and match them as you like to get the best result for your needs
  3. Additionally, you can also convert images from PNG to JPEG if they don't use alpha channel to save even more space
  4. Click the button to reduce image size and wait a moment while plugin is doing its job


Useful tips

  1. I recommend setting the compression level to any value greater than 30, otherwise, you may significantly lose in image quality, but feel free to experiment with it
  2. About the Resizing feature: let's say that your 100x100 object has a 200x200 image fill, but you chose a 4x multiplier — instead of "upscaling" the image to 400x400 it'll keep its original size of 200x200 px.
  3. If you're unhappy with the result, you can always hit ⌘Z and try different settings.
  4. I takes some time to run Downsize in huge files, so selecting frames/images first and then running the plugin will do it faster.


——————————


Downsize images, not talents! 😉


Made with 🧡 & ✨.

Alex
plugins.tagline: Compress and resize images without leaving Figma!

plugins.name: Aninix · Lottie Animation
plugins.description:
Currently in public beta.


The purpose of Aninix is to provide the handiest way to create UI animations. To this end, we have specifically limited the animation features to those supported by native platforms (iOS, android and web). Therefore, all the animations you create can be easily incorporated into the product by developers.


🎥 Quick introductory guide (10 mins video):

  1. English version;
  2. Версия на русском.


🗒 Interactive guide and animated examples (10 mins reading and clicking):

  1. English version;
  2. Версия на русском.


---


FEATURES


Import of prototypes

Don't start from scratch. Figma has done an amazing job of making animations in prototypes easy to work with. But when Figma's capabilities aren't enough, we provide an easy way to improve your animation with keyframe system.


Animation presets

To speed up work on animations, we have created a hand-crafted library of animated presets. One click and the animation is ready. And later you can customize it to your liking.


Lottie

As a fact, the Lottie format is the most used in the world when it comes to small animations in products. We don't stand on the sidelines and have made full support of this.


Developer handoff (animation specifications)

But when Lottie is not enough, or you have a complex animation in mind, we provide a simple view of your animation for developers. Support for all necessary animated properties and CSS code generation.


Export to all popular formats

If you need the media format, we give you the ability to export to all popular formats: .mp4, .gif, .webm, .svg and .png sequence.


2-way Figma synchronization

For a more intuitive animation process, we made it possible to start and continue working on animations directly from Figma.


---


CONTACTS


👾 Discord: https://aninix.com/discord

🎥 Youtube: https://aninix.com/youtube

🌎 Website: https://www.aninix.com


---


FAQ


How it differentiate from other animation plugins?

We aim to create an analog to After Effects, but much simpler, so that designers can create powerful animations in a fast and easy way.

Our main difference is in the rendering engine and viewport. In Aninix, you work in a separate window and don't use the Figma viewport, unlike other plugins.

This feature allows us to create the best UX we can provide.


How it differentiate from other animation apps?

It's just our mentality and vision of how animation should work. We are strongly focused on UI animation and do our best to make life easier for product designers. We really love Figma and want to take it to the next level with animation flows.


How to start using Aninix?

Just run plugin: "Plugins -> Aninix" and it will navigate you through next steps.


How can I be sure of data security when working with Aninix?

The plugin system feels not stable. And you are still in beta.

Yes, we are in the beta stage. But data safety and protection is one of the fundamental rules of our development. That's why we take great care to make sure that your data is protected.

All animated data is stored on each of the Figma layers. If you copy-paste the layers, you copy-paste the animation as well. You can make unlimited copies of your animation on every iteration.

We also use Figma's mechanism to store file history. So you can navigate through your file history to download older versions of the animation.


What kind of animations I can do with this plugin?

Aninix is best suits with the development of a motion design system, where you animate buttons, screen appearing and transitions, etc.

Also you can create promotional material for social media or other animated content, but that's like a side effect of what we do.

You can check examples at our playground.


Does it support all features from Figma?

Currently no. You can check full list of supported features here: https://www.aninix.com/wiki/supported-figma-features


Is there any special requirements to files?

No 🙂

But Aninix is ignoring all unsupported features. So it would be better to design file with using of supported features only.

But this is temporal turnaround because we plan to add all features from Figma in nearest future.


Where I can check the list of hotkeys?

Please visit: https://www.aninix.com/wiki/hotkeys.


Where is my data stored?

All animation data is stored locally on our servers and as a copy in Figma files. It's required to provide additional data-safety layer and multiplayer features we plan to ship in the future. We are using Google Cloud Platform.


I found a bug. What I have to do?

First of all don't panic 😉

Aninix saves your data automatically so you wouldn't lost any progress. And as the next step please leave comment here or reach our founder directly at tony@aninix.com.
plugins.tagline: Add interactivity to Figma with Lottie animation. Export Lottie animations, GIFs, or mp4.

plugins.name: AI image generator by Freepik
plugins.description:
AI image generator by Freepik


With AI Image Generator by Freepik you can instantly create the perfect image for your project by simply typing in a description (aka prompt) of what you want to see.


How many free AI images can I generate?

With this free plugin, you can use it up to 16 different times each day. Each time, we'll generate 4 unique images (which means a total of 64 unique AI generated images every day).


What resolutions and aspect ratios are available?

The Freepik AI image generator plugin can generate square images (1024 x 1024), portrait images (1024 x 1536) and landscape images (1536 x 1024).


You can also crop these images after they’ve been added to your Figma page or document.


How do I get started?

Each time this plugin opens, you'll be presented with a default prompt that allows you to generate 4-images without typing a thing. You can also cycle through different AI prompts to explore new and different ideas, or enter your own (to suit the project or design goals you have in mind).


How do I use this plugin?

Click the "Open in..." button on this page. Then, when your Figma document is ready, click the "Run" button. From there, the AI image generator by Freepik plugin will be ready to use.


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ):

  • Does this Figma Plugin cost anything? It does not. It's free! You can use it up to 16 times every day. We just ask that you share some feedback with us here: https://freepikcompany.typeform.com/to/rfUzOJ4y
  • How can I share feedback with you? We’d love to hear what could be improved. To do so, please leave us some feedback here: https://freepikcompany.typeform.com/to/rfUzOJ4y
  • How do I access all of Freepik’s 100 million assets? The fastest way is to visit freepik.com.
  • Does Freepik offer any other plugins? We currently have 4 plugins that are free to use, and we'll be launching more in the coming months. You can find them all here: https://www.figma.com/@freepik


Having some trouble?

Please contact us as integrations@freepik.com with any questions, feedback or concerns you have.

plugins.name: Figma to Flutter, HTML, Next.js, and React | DhiWise Design (rocket.new)
plugins.description:
DhiWise Design Converter (rocket.new): Transform Designs into Code

Supports Flutter, HTML, Next.js, and React


Developer-centric code generation in minutes! ⚡


Elevate your application development by turning Figma designs into production-grade code within a few clicks, or design from scratch using our extensive library of design assets.


✨ What is Rocket.new?


Rocket.new enables developers to seamlessly convert their designs into clean, modular, reusable, and scalable code for mobile and web applications.


Why choose us over other tools?

Rocket.new stands out in the development tools, providing a suite of features that enhance productivity and streamline the development process. Here’s why you should choose Rocket.new for your next project:


  1. Custom AI Models: Our platform leverages our custom VisionAI models and more than 2000+ custom in-house algorithms in a hybrid approach to accurately identify 100+ UI components to generate code for complex UI components such as sliders, tables, links in footers, and more.

plugins.name: Export Figma to Websites and HTML by Siter.io
plugins.description:
Siter.io is a website builder that lets you create and publish entire websites without any coding at all. It works by directly exporting Figma design files without hassle of converting your layout into HTML and CSS. After the export, you can make changes and adjustments directly on Siter.io, and easily add responsive versions for your pages.


Also, you can embed/insert HTML code directly on your websites through your visual editor on Siter.io.


How Figma to HTML Website works:

  1. Install the plugin
  2. In Figma select the art-board with your website
  3. Choose "Plugins" and click on Export Figma to Websites / HTML by Siter.io
  4. Pair the Siter.io with Figma
  5. Export your designs!


Watch video -> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BG8rsZdR_SQ

Download HTML code from Figma -> https://help.siter.io/article/210-download-html

Static HTML hosting -> https://static.app/


Suggestions? → https://siter.io/

Status -> https://status.siter.io/

*A Designmodo project.
plugins.tagline: Publish Figma designs as websites without the need for coding. Embed HTML code into your website.

plugins.name: Similayer
plugins.description:
This plugin takes Figma’s in-built ‘Select all with...’ command to the next level. 🔥

Select similar layers; based on a whole range of properties.


Select other layers...

After selecting a layer, run this plugin to select all other layers based on specific properties.


[NEW] Select within...

If you select multiple layers first, you can choose which properties and values to reduce the selection.


---


A small favour — if you find this plugin helpful, why not support me by Buying me a Coffee


---


Example use cases:

• Selecting all instances of a specific component to swap out for a different one

• Changing all layers with a specific Text Style to a new one

• Selecting all ‘cards’ with the same corner radius and fill color

• etc.



Supported properties

Here's a full list of all the properties that this plugin supports. If there's one missing that you'd love to see. Let me know at david@williames.com


Components:

  • Other component instances
  • Other component variants
  • Component scale factor


Text

  • Text Style
  • Font size
  • Font family
  • Font style
  • Text case
  • Text decoration
  • Letter spacing
  • Line height
  • Horizontal alignment
  • Vertical alignments
  • Auto resize
  • Text characters
  • Paragraph style
  • Paragraph indent
  • Paragraph spacing


Fills

  • Fill Style
  • Fill color
  • Fill opacity
  • No fills


Strokes

  • Stroke Style
  • Stroke color
  • Stroke width
  • Stroke opacity
  • Stroke position
  • Stroke cap
  • Stroke join
  • Stroke dash pattern
  • No strokes


Effects

  • Effect Style
  • Effect radius
  • Shadow color
  • Shadow offset


Auto Layout

  • Has Auto layout?
  • Layout direction
  • Layout sizing (Primary direction)
  • Layout sizing (Counter direction)
  • Layout alignment (Primary direction)
  • Layout alignment (Counter direction)
  • Item spacing
  • Padding (All)
  • Top padding
  • Right padding
  • Bottom padding
  • Left padding


Layout

  • Size
  • Width
  • Height
  • Position (all)
  • X Position
  • Y Position
  • Absolute position (all)
  • Absolute X position
  • Absolute Y position
  • Rotation
  • Corner radius (all)
  • Top-left radius
  • Top-right radius
  • Bottom-right radius
  • Bottom-left radius


Layers

  • Layer name
  • Blend mode
  • Layer opacity
  • Layer type
  • Is locked?
  • Is mask?
  • Is visible?


Images

  • Image filters (all)
  • Image exposure
  • Image contrast
  • Image saturation
  • Image temperature
  • Image tint
  • Image highlights
  • Image shadows


Export settings

  • Export settings (all)
  • Export format
  • Export suffix
  • Export constraint
  • Export contents only?


Prototype

  • Prototype reactions (all)
  • Action destination
  • Action type
  • Navigation type
  • Trigger type
  • Prototype transition (all)
  • Transition type
  • Transition easing
  • Transition duration
  • Transition direction

plugins.name: Detach Component
plugins.description:
Detach components and variants, just like you detach instances with this simple plugin.


Ever been annoyed by the fact that once you create a component or variants, there’s no going back? Select a main component or a set of variants and run this simple plugin to revert them back to a frame in the same way "Detach Instance" does with your instances.


Can I detach multiple components or variant sets?


You sure can! Select as many as you like and run the plugin.


What if the component has instances?


Any instances will remain untouched. You will also still be able to right click an instance and go to "Main Component" —> "Restore Main Component" to restore
